sources.title: "A Woman Scorned" (1911) director D. W. Griffith cinematographer Billy Bitzer
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   "A Woman Scorned" is a short drama, included in our program to illustrate the work of Billy Bitzer, a star of Silent Hall of Fame. A doctor is lured away under false pretenses, and then his home is targeted for burglary. The plot is similar to that of "Lonely Villa" (1909), with an added twist.   Directed by                       D.W. Griffith Cinematography by         Billy Bitzer Starring                             Claire McDowell, Wilfred Lucas, Alfred Paget, Blanche Sweet Distributed by                   Biograph Company Release date                       November 30, 1911 Country                             United States Running time                    13 m.   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. metadata.Plot: Thieves follow a doctor as he takes home a large sum of money. Later, when they break into his house, the doctor's wife and daughter are trapped. One of the thieves has jilted his sweetheart, who tells the doctor of the robbery, and helps him save his family.
metadata.Actors: Wilfred Lucas, Claire McDowell, Ynez Seabury
